page.title: 13SHOPPING/TRANSPORT
page.content: Most of the shops in the centre of Hope have changed in the last century and there are now fewer businesses. The main shops are a greengrocers, a butchers, two grocery stores plus a Post Office and a Book/Craft shop. There are two banks which only open part time. Whilst Bradwell has a few more shops than Hope most residents travel to Sheffield for any major purchases. Many will travel there each week even for basic necessities. Whilst most people travel by car, it is possible to go by either train or bus. There are about four trains a day in each direction and about six buses. A bus travels to Bakewell each Monday morning to take the villagers to the large market held there each week.
